AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: No customer-facing AI response is present. The only AI-related entries are internal status comments (e.g., Centralsupport-ai-acc), so there is no evidence of AI giving incorrect/irrelevant information or making unfulfilled promises to the customer.
evidence: Kayako - ticket id 60226631 // Centralsupport-ai-acc commented privately: JIRA Issue CARESMM-9351 is changed to 'In Progress'

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer is not shown interacting with an AI agent repeatedly, nor requesting a human and being refused. Human agents respond and escalate the issue.
evidence: Deepanshu Dewan commented publicly: "As discussed, your ticket has been assigned to an agent."
Pavly Nashed commented publicly: "this has been escalated to our infrastructure team with the highest priority"

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support does not re-ask for information already provided, and they do address the customer’s concern about recurrence by providing an explanation and stating preventive actions (monitoring/controls/isolation).
evidence: Jayashree Shetty: "We have been encountering this issue repeatedly... Kindly confirm whether the fix you have implemented will prevent this issue from recurring"

Balaji Jayaraman: "The disruption was triggered by background data processing placing unexpected load on our search infrastructure... We’re strengthening monitoring and controls... to prevent recurrence."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: No gap of 3+ calendar days between a customer message and a support response is present in the excerpt. Customer messages receive same-day responses.

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket is not shown being closed in the customer-facing system after an unanswered customer question. Instead, support explicitly states it will remain open for a week unless the customer confirms closure.
evidence: Balaji Jayaraman: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with 'This ticket can be closed'"

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: While the issue is clearly production-impacting, the ticket is not explicitly marked P1/SEV1/Critical in the provided interactions, and support behavior shows escalation and infrastructure engagement rather than generic end-user troubleshooting.
evidence: Customer: "We are unable to view or claim any new incoming chats... Manager are currently assigning chats to the team manually."
Pavly Nashed: "escalated to our infrastructure team with the highest priority"
Jira/Infra notes indicate active remediation: "Elasticsearch service was restarted... It is being worked on in an IM call, Escalating to DevOps"
